summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York providing additional discovery in the case United States v. Michael Thomas. It references a protective order and designates certain materials as protected, with some materials produced only to the defendant.

persons.name: Montell Figgins
persons.context: Attorney representing the defendant Michael Thomas, as the letter is addressed to his law office.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Michael Thomas, case number 19 Cr. 830.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who is authorizing the discovery letter.

connections.description: Figgins is the attorney representing defendant Michael Thomas in the criminal case.
Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority in the case against Thomas.

events.title: Protective Order Entered
events.description: A protective order was entered in the case United States v. Michael Thomas, governing the disclosure of materials.

events.title: Discovery Letter Sent
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sent a letter providing additional discovery to defense counsel in the Michael Thomas case.

keyFacts: The document is a discovery letter in the criminal case United States v. Michael Thomas (No. 19 Cr. 830).
It references a protective order entered on December 16, 2019, that restricts disclosure of certain materials.
Some materials are being produced only to the defendant, Michael Thomas, indicating sensitive content.
The letter is from Acting U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss and is addressed to defense attorney Montell Figgins.
